header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends

body.u: I think yesterday went quite well don't you? the ruby wedding party that we went to
yes it did and I think everyone had a good time
and er it's nice to have a chat to er extended members of the family that I have not seen for some time
to what extent do you think it was a surprise?

well she said it was a surprise I asked her and she said she hadn't got any idea whether it was a good idea or not I don't know because a few weeks before the party she'd said if anybody gives me a surprise party I'd really hate that
so I don't know and er also they'd only just come back from holidays the day before so I think they could have been a bit tired
and the other thing is I think if she'd have known it was a party she'd have probably got dressed up a bit more
also might have made a better and longer speech if he'd have had a bit more time to consider what to say
is that an advantage or a disadvantage?
it depends whether you like listening to 's speeches or not really
I think we the journey went quite well we got there easily didn't we?
yes I think one advantage was er not having to drive in as many er urban areas
I think the erm A18 managed to mm to some extent provide a bit of a ring road between the and the venue
yes it's a spectacular bridge the isn't it?
it's quite stunning is that mm
yes it was er erm out on on the landscape for at least about a fifteen to twenty mile radius from
definitely yes it is it's stunning
and it was a nice bright day as well
with a nice view of the and we could see
we did it was all a sparkle
mm you operated the satnav very efficiently didn't you?
and it took us straight to the venue
so as grandad says it's not the driving but the parking that's the problem but another problem can be the navigation can't it?
but the satnav does take some of the guesswork out of it doesn't it?
it does although erm admittedly sometimes it does take you on a rather obscure route
such as when we were on erm our holiday we were
going down some almost single tracks
yes the good thing about it though is if you want to go a certain way it does recalculate it doesn't it?
if you want to take a particular route
mm it also lets you know whether you are happy that the road is a toll road or not
oh right yes actually I thought the toll on the bridge was less this time than when we've been before
I thought it had gone down
yes I think they seem to be doing some refurbishment to the toll booths
I think they're trying to make it into some sort of plaza complex
well it is part of the refurbishment programme
oh right it's mm we really need to find the charger for that satnav because I don't think it's got much battery left now has it?
it has not you can recharge it via the plug erm
no from a a three pin socket in the house
we've got the charger at the back
but we don't have the in-car charger which
is just means that if you're doing a journey of more than ninety minutes
erm you are not really able to use the satnav
yes oh right and I had my first selfie at the party
you did you've had it even before I have
of all the original bridesmaids on that day forty years ago
I don't know what I think to selfies really they look a bit funny sometimes really like you have to group in so tightly you lo look like you're in one of those photo booths don't you?
which er is a big strange and it's amazing how things have changed really my parents had their wedding photographs taken on glass plates
it's amazing what's happened in a generation
it is and from my point of view if I was shown that photograph erm without knowing what occasion it was was
wedding photograph I I think I would have failed to have recognised a er the people in it if I had just come it across it by an off chance
the the people have changed so much since then
also it highlights the different fashions th blonde hair and
er rather sturdy boots for the occasion and
well it was the seventies it's called the decade that fashion forgot sometimes
yes and we also got given from one of my other cousins a digitalised DVD of an old cine film
which I'm hoping to watch apparently
of my cousins opening their Christmas presents
so that'll be interesting to see
right I don't it might be about the time the transition time
it was on the television yeah and then we had a photograph taken of all the people that were present on that wedding day forty years ago
I'm afraid we're dwindling in number
we are but also percentage of the people who attended the party
yes mm were there yes so it kind of filled me with a bit of nostalgia really
which is a longing for something that you can't have the past but there again
at least you've captured the moment
yes if it was the past then I wouldn't have you would I?
and I wouldn't want to miss out on that and er we got back safely took the same route didn't we?
I was pretty tired though when we got back
so how long did it take us that journey?
I think it was approximately a hundred minutes
yes and how far was that?
er how far? erm well I think it's was about twenty-nine miles from the
and then I think it's thirty-four from the to the house
so I think it was possibly about sixty-two miles in total
yeah but it's a lot quicker than when we used to go when we were young and of course the wasn't there
we had to go round via which took us hours and hours
that was really a tortuous route
going out of your way the wrong direction before you could turn round to come back
you couldn't cross the river in those days
but er disadvantage of using the erm boat at the time was that the
the er sandbanks that accumulated in the over the erm meant that sometimes you would be stranded on a sandbank
well that occaoccasionally happened it never happened when I was on it but and it was quite good fun on the ferry anyway
we used to get lemonade and crisps and be looking out it was quite nice really
yes so long did did that take?
I can't remember I'd only be quite small I don't know not very long would it?
no maybe a quarter of an hour
maybe tw yeah I was going to say twenty minutes yes
yeah one thing was loading up getting the cars on and
all the people and that sort of thing
that would take er quite a bit of time
it's erm amazing the erm suspension bridge that is currently in place
erm that er did used to be one of the world's longest suspension bridges
it was for at time yes I think it's been superseded now hasn't it? with
yes er I think it it's a bridge in China but I'm not sure
yes I think you're right mm yeah I don't think they've got the record any more
no but the Chinese have been erm building significant er infrastructure projects with their
and lots of suspension bridges had erm lots of railway projects
high speed rail they've really spent a lot of money
mm and er they got some nice presents didn't they?
somebody got them that rose that's called Ruby Wedding
we nearly got that didn't we?
but I thought somebody else might get it so
I think they got some theatre vouchers
erm got er some sort of candelabra
I didn't see what anybody else had bought did you?
mm did you think the er I suppose a book of memories that was presented
it was lovely I I was surprised that the book was made of wood wasn't it?
and it had little erm hearts carved out of it didn't it?
so it was very attractive haven't seen one like that anywhere else
and er a lot of old photographs and that I hadn't seen before
and er there's the er place was nicely decorated with balloons and
rose petals and bunting thought that the girls had done a good job
yes I was not expecting to help out actually
no well it was a good job we were a bit early because I I don't think they would have been ready is we hadn't turned up actually
there was still quite a bit to do wasn't there laying the tables and
getting all the food out setting up the glasses and cups and saucers
I thought they'd er done well to get it all ready and think they'd obviously stayed up late making the cake and decorating it
and putting the vases of flowers and the candles for the table decorations
I in some ways I mm don't like pinning things up when I have to stand on a chair because
I know it's a bit dangerous isn't it?
I I was nervous that I might fall or especially when the they had to particularly overhang the
yeah oh yes and I never thought I who I must admit am not a very athletic person
would ever hold one of the Olympic torches
but er but 's husband had been one of the
yeah torch bearers as the the relay went around the country didn't it?
and he had er got the torch which was quite big what
would you say? how long do you th I'd say it was about a metre wouldn't you?
the thing that surprised me is I thought it was quite top-heavy
cos just when I first held it I held it at a sl a slant because I was expecting the weight to be evenly distributed
yes it wasn't was it? I think because there must be the burner in the top end
it's made it heavy but at the pointy end it was quite light wasn't it?
so you needed to hold it higher up didn't you?
yeah another one for the album there
yes er but perhaps a an unusual one
er very yes not many people can say they've held the Olympic torch can they?
so he did well to get chosen didn't he?
well I suppose he does have a lot possibly has a bit to do with sport and athletics
does he still does he still play rugby?
rugby is not really a a sport that I er would like to do really any more I think it's a little bit on the rough side
it's a bit dangerous really isn't it?
it can be very physical I think you've tried it but you didn't especially like it did you?
no and I'm not too sorry really because it's not much fun standing on the touchlines on
one of the things I I don't particularly like er sort of getting soil all over my clothes and
oh no you get dirty definitely
oh yes and you need a good bath after that don't you?
yeah I know yeah I know I think it's er well that is when I'm trying to do tennis it's er that shouldn't happen
no yes it's that's more of a summer game though isn't it?
yes I no it is having said that that is a more of a summer game rather than
it is isn't it and we saw airport
but we didn't see many aircraft there though what

no it's it's dwindled a lot since the start of the recession the original airports such as and have really seen a massive reduction in air travel I think have seen the lowest level for about fifteen twenty years
why's that? because there aren't the number of people going on foreign holidays or
well erm airlines have pulled out erm certain airlines have closed down erm have they've just er they have not been able to keep it up
so it restricts consumer choice really because it means you've got to go to the bigger airports like Manchester
yes I think one issue is is that many airlines tend to operate like to operate the same class of aircraft so that they erm all operate within say the A320 group or
Boeing seven three seven group because that means lower maintenance costs
so those aircraft are at least a hundred and twenty possibly up to two hundred and twenty depending exactly what they're in and just simply will not be the demand for that er
passengers that they can have yes
mm whereas really you want to be using smaller aircraft with maybe fifty to seventy seats
which erm would would be a commercially viable option but it's just not what airlines like to do
because you think you could fill them up easier?
there was er one commercial aircraft at the airport when we came back
it was an Eastern Airways BAE Jetstream thirty-one
it's only a small little aircraft with thirty-one seats
oh that is very small isn't it?
and there was a couple of helicopt
yes well I think they get quite a lot of trade from North Sea oil rigs

yes I think that is a a significant erm source of revenue for the airport erm I'm not sure what the future is going to be like erm I think there's an element of change from er aircraft use to more high-speed rail I think er cos Eurostar is putting er more pressure on routes such as Paris and Brussels and Viale and obviously you can connect there to as far as Spain and Italy and Germany and erm northern Europe so that is a new source of competition that has really erm started to take over domestic routes domestic and short haul routes

I actually prefer going on the Eurostar because I find it less stressful than having to go through all the checks that you have to go through for the airport it seems much more relaxed and I think the the ride is more pleasant it's more airy
and you can get about and er go down to the buffet car and things
there aren't as many restrictions on your luggage are there?
you can more or less take on as much as you can carry and as much as
you can manage so I think it's more relaxed
and it's a very smooth ride isn't it?
it is well I think they are welded tracks
yes it's a special erm type of track for that sort of speed
and er and you can see the countryside
you can that's lovely some of it yes
it's much more interesting isn't it especially when we've er been through France
they're quite rural areas aren't they?
all there are village churches and
yes they're quite attractive aren't they?

and sowing them yes what I think er would be a good boost except I think in some ways er the Italian railway operator Trenitalia is erm buying some trains that erm are able to recognise and receive all the types of signals and power across Europe
because each country has different voltages and signalling systems
so it should allow er more flexibility in
furthermore they are erm opening a new railway line between Turin and Marseilles
erm which will almost halve the journey time between Paris and Milan so from seven hours to about three and a half
gosh that would be an achievement that wouldn't it?
it would but it's will take quite a bit of time because they're having to drill under the Alps
oh wow so there's quite some technical challenges
yes but I think it would definitely be well worth going on I think it will definitely mean that the mid and southern part of Italy is reachable from the north of England in a day
it would mean you can just about get to Milan in a day
but mm you can't get to erm Rome or
anywhere like that in a day
no yeah that's still good though
yes and you you could have a different sort of holiday you could have
yeah stop off have different centres that you visit and as you make your progress to the furthest destination couldn't you?
I think that would be quite an interesting way to do it
it would it would it would require some very effective organisation because
those sort of high-speed trains if you buy the ticket on the day it will cost
so if you you have to book it you know at least for a few months in advance to to get the
yeah so it would have to be well planned
because if you did book on the erm not that far in advance
it would probably be more expensive than flying
which is a shame because I think with the European Union going from one extreme to banning Hoovers that are too er powerful
they don't think about well what is a significant cause of pollution? how that would be an easy fix to have
compared to doing something as I don't know that's not going to make as much difference like banning
no yeah but they're trying to make it competitively priced really
I think the issue is banning Hoovers is an easy target and building a lot of railways is a big organisation
that's more difficult isn't it definitely
and costs a lot more money
but erm I think it is starting to come together I think they are getting erm new railways built and
obviously trains that can run in most of Europe it should help to
yeah that's very versatile isn't it?
good would you be tempted to go on that? or
yes definitely it sounds er quite an adventure doesn't it?
yes I think one place which we have gone on holiday is Greece and I I think
that would be quite tricky to do by rail because erm you're going through countries that don't really have a really impressive rail system
I mean Greece doesn't have such an impressive railway system
er that sort of area but
most of the some of the rolling stock is sort of from the former Soviet Union so it's a bit
but apparently it can be done in three days
it's a bit of time that
but it should improve because there's a a new line between Thessaloniki and Athens which should speed things up a bit
I think they're trying to erm invest in er public spending projects in order to help the deficit in Greece
to try and get people erm
it would having said that they are making improvements to the Greek rail system because they are erm are now online you can book tickets online now which you
yes so I think that would help them because
they have made some big losses erm in the past

mm said that she wasn't really interested on going on any more flights because she finds it too tiring now that she's getting a bit older but er they've just got one holiday left that's already booked which is flying and they're going to Israel
so tha she's just a little bit
concerned yes about how safe that is going to be
they're going to fly and they're going for six days
but they really want to go and look at Bethlehem

in particular erm but she doesn't know whether she's going to be disappointed when she sees it because I think you possibly have a preconceived idea that it's going to look something like a Christmas card and if it er is a situation that is a little bit tense in that country it might spoil your idea of what it looks like and what it should be there potentially be a bit of a mismatch
mm I think in some ways they've picked the wrong time to go really because I think in the past few years the tensions between Gaza and Israel have not as been as heightened
as they have in the last

yes I suppose they've been waiting until they've got retired and they've picked one or two other holidays they recently wanted to go to Crete erm because that's where their father was fighting during the war

and what with the anniversary of the First World War coming up they thought it would probably be appropriate to go and walk in the footsteps of where he was in Crete and er well not see what he had to contend with but just look at the countryside and they didn't tell us too much about what they actually found there did they?
I think he did survive so
yes he did survive yes he did get back
erm there wouldn't have been a a grave or anything to see
no no but there could have been some other landmarks or museums and
yes yes I think in some ways it would have been very emotional for them to think
that erm a hundred years ago the
well it wasn't the first oh yes it was the Second World War that he was fighting in though wasn't it?
oh right so that would have been
the then it wouldn't be a hundred years
no I think it's the hundred years anniversary that just prompted them to think about it I think
yeah I sup it must be a surprise to think that that would have been the case
but obviously er I think they'd have had a rather more enjoyable experience than the
er I don't suppose I suppose er on a the slightly positive side of it it cer I don't think it would have been as bad as the Somme and that lot
I think it will have still have been very er emotional and er
but so which erm area did he fight in? is it army and navy or air force or?
army I presumed I think yes army I think
yeah do you remember ? so you remember seeing him do you remember seeing ?
you may be a bit young to remember him
yes but in some ways it's a a little shame that they didn't go when he was er alive
mm to take him back yeah to see him to see the place in a better light
yes also he would have been able to tell them that that
to point out the venues and that yeah you're right
I think he was probably just glad to get away from it
